title: 399. Honey, I Grew the Economy
description: Innovation experts have long overlooked where a lot of innovation actually happens. The personal computer, the mountain bike, the artificial pancreas — none of these came from some big R&D lab, but from users tinkering in their homes. Acknowledging this reality — and encouraging it — would be good for the economy (and the soul too).
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
